description:
You are given an integer array height of length n. There are n vertical lines drawn such that the two endpoints of the ith line are (i, 0) and (i, height[i]). Find two lines that together with the x-axis form a container, such that the container contains the most water. Return the maximum amount of water a container can store. ***Notice that you may not slant the container.*** ![](https://s3-lc-upload.s3.amazonaws.com/uploads/2018/07/17/question_11.jpg) **`Example 1: `**
**`Input:`**
`height = [1,8,6,2,5,4,8,3,7] ` **`Output:`**
`49` **`Explanation:`**
`The above vertical lines are represented by array [1,8,6,2,5,4,8,3,7].`
I`n this case, the max area of water (blue section) the container can contain is 49. ` **`Example 2: `** **`Input:`**
`height = [1,1] `
**`Output:1`** **`Constraints:`** - `n == height.length ` - `2 <= n <= 10^5 ` - `0 <= height[i] <= 10^4 `
title: Container With Most Water
